results.title: Anthony Lucas talks about 'The Cabinet of Anthony Lucas: The Faulty Fandangle'
results.creator_credit: Jason White, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Oscar nominated animator Anthony Lucas (‘The Mysterious Geographic Explorations of Jasper Morello’) speaks candidly about his creative processes and inspirations. He introduces his latest work, ‘The Cabinet of Anthony Lucas: The Faulty Fandangle’, commissioned for ACMI’s ‘Screen Worlds’ exhibition. He takes us on a creative adventure from beginning to end, starting with initial ideas and inspiration, right through to the creation of the on-screen animation and mechanised components.

results.title: Michael Connor: in conversation with Conrad Bodman

video_links.name: Michael Connor: in conversation with Conrad Bodman

results.brief_description: Michael Connor, Consultant Curator of ‘Screen Worlds: The Story of Film, Television and Digital Culture’, is in conversation with Conrad Bodman, ACMI’s Head of Exhibitions. Connor discusses both the overall concept and the separate sections of the exhibition. Connor and Bodman discuss some of the challenges of choosing, sourcing and exhibiting over a hundred years of creative work and technology relating to the moving image.

results.title: Raj Roy interview: 'Tim Burton: The Exhibition'

video_links.name: Raj Roy interview: 'Tim Burton: The Exhibition'

results.brief_description: As Head of Film at MoMA (The Museum of Modern Art), New York, Raj Roy discusses the role of the film department including acquisitions, exhibitions, research, and preservation. Roy then speaks of his broad involvement in ‘Tim Burton: The Exhibition’, including the challenge of selecting the chosen artworks from tens of thousands of archived pieces. His main hope for the exhibition is that it will spark the creativity of budding artists and create the next Tim Burton.

results.title: Ron Magliozzi and Jenny He interview: 'Tim Burton: The Exhibition'

video_links.name: Ron Magliozzi and Jenny He interview: 'Tim Burton: The Exhibition'

results.brief_description: Jenny He (Curatorial Assistant, Department of Film) and Ron Magliozzi (Assistant Curator, Department of Film) are co-organizers of the Tim Burton exhibition, from MoMa (The Museum of Modern Art) in New York. Here they are interviewed by Kate Warren, ACMI’s Assistant Curator, about their work on ‘Tim Burton: The Exhibition’. They take us through the process, from inception, through to collaborating with Tim Burton, of Burton’s work and the curatorial process. As well as viewing Tim Burton’s work from an artistic perspective, we also gain insight into the art of the curator and curatorial perspective.

results.title: [The Vault]
results.creator_credit: Bill Nicholson Jr, Bronwen Gray and Alan Young
results.brief_description:
Fresh out of university, Bill Nicholson’s first professional job involved him identifying human remains located in the vault of the Melbourne Museum. Some of those remains were traced back to Truganina Explosives Reserve in Altona. This animation tells the story of how these remains, discovered in Melbourne’s west, were returned to their traditional resting place.
Please note : This animation is based on a story told by Aboriginal Bill Nicholson Jr, visually interpreted by a white artist.

group.title: Unreserved : stories from Truganina Explosives Reserve

results.title: [Jim's Story]
results.brief_description: Jim Melmoth began working at the Truganina Explosives Reserve in Altona at the age of 20 as part of the maintenance crew. He helped to build the extension on the pier and the water tower, which is still intact on the site today.

group.title: Unreserved : stories from Truganina Explosives Reserve

group_siblings.title: [The Vault]
group_siblings.creator_credit: Bill Nicholson Jr, Bronwen Gray and Alan Young

results.title: [The Dead Table]
results.brief_description: There’s never been any explosions at the Truganina Explosives Reserve in Altona, but accidents, well that’s another story. As a child, Alan Dyall’s father worked at the reserve in Melbourne’s west. One of his many jobs involved ‘laying out in the lighters’, a lighter being a boat that carried explosives from Williamstown to the steamship. If the steamship hadn’t yet arrived, it was his job to sleep on board until it did. This is a childhood of tales lovingly recalled and the amazing story of his father’s near fatal accident.

group.title: Unreserved : stories from Truganina Explosives Reserve

group_siblings.title: [The Vault]
group_siblings.creator_credit: Bill Nicholson Jr, Bronwen Gray and Alan Young

results.title: [Celebrating the Site's Industrial Life]
results.brief_description: Originally established for the storing and handling of commercial explosives, the reserve is one of Altona’s few intact examples of its rich industrial history. This animation brings to life the story of explosives, the working life of the Truganina Explosives Reserve and its place in the history of Melbourne’s western region.

group.title: Unreserved : stories from Truganina Explosives Reserve

group_siblings.title: [The Vault]
group_siblings.creator_credit: Bill Nicholson Jr, Bronwen Gray and Alan Young

results.title: [Celebrating the Site's Flora and Fauna]
results.brief_description: Truganina Explosives Reserve in Altona is an environmental wonderland, containing rare flora and fauna. Much of the original landscape has remained untouched for over 100 years. This takes us back to a time when it was formally landscaped, and representative of the early Edwardian planting of the late 1880s. Please enjoy a serene journey through the reserve, celebrating this unique ecosystem.

results.title: The First Wave
results.creator_credit: Pip Starr, Thomas Parkinson, Liz Burke and Liz Burke Films
results.brief_description:
The people of the Carteret Islands are about to make history. They will soon begin abandoning their small chain of islands, as rising seas make them increasingly uninhabitable. These islands are a group of coral atolls, just north of Papua New Guinea. The people will be re-locating to Bougainville, which is a move fraught with cultural and political problems. They will be the first people in the world to make such a move, but they will not be the last.

In ‘The First Wave’ we meet the Islanders for the first time and see their island home. We experience their traditional life-style and hear their hopes and fears for the future. There are differing opinions amongst the Islanders about what they want but their fear is that no-one is listening.
